dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3170 IH: Improving Access to Workers’ Compensation for Injured Federal Workers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Walberg (for himself and Mr. Courtney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend chapter 81 of title 5, United States Code, to cover, for purposes of workers’ compensation under such chapter, services by physician assistants and nurse practitioners provided to injured Federal workers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Access to Workers’ Compensation for Injured Federal Workers Act.

section.header: Inclusion of physician assistants and nurse practitioners in Federal Employees’ Compensation Act

subsection.text: Section 8101 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by inserting , other eligible providers, after osteopathic practitioners;
by striking and at the end of paragraphs (18) and (19);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (20) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
other eligible provider means a nurse practitioner or physician assistant within the scope of their practice as defined by State law.

subsection.text: Chapter 81 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or other eligible provider after physician each place it appears; and
in paragraph (3), by inserting or other eligible providers after physicians;

paragraph.text: in section 8121(6), by inserting or other eligible provider after physician; and

subparagraph.text: by inserting or other eligible provider after The employee may have a physician; and
by inserting or other eligible provider after United States and the physician.

subsection.text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Labor shall finalize rules to carry out the amendments made by this Act.
